content: May 3 (Reuters) - RS Group said on Wednesday that David Egan would step down as finance chief of the electronics products distributor with immediate effect following a personal relationship with a colleague.

The 55-year-old Egan, who joined RS as its CFO in 2016, also resigned from his role as a director and will leave the company, RS said."Very recently I notified the board of a personal relationship with a colleague. Following a detailed review by the board, I recognise that there have been some shortcomings of judgment on my part and my actions have fallen short of the high standards expected of RS leadership," Egan said in a statement issued by the company."Therefore, it is right for me to step down from my role."The London-based company appointed Jane Titchener, its vice president of corporate development, as interim CFO.RS did not disclose details about the employee Egan had a relationship with.Egan was previously the finance director at Alent Plc, a supplier of consumable engineered material, before joining RS.Shares of RS, formerly known as Electrocomponents, have nearly quadrupled in the seven years Egan was CFO. They fell as much as 4.8% on Wednesday on the news of his resignation but recovered to trade down about 1.5%.RS said there was no change to its profit expectations and that it would announce full-year results on May 23. (Reporting by Radhika Anilkumar and Eva Mathews in Bengaluru; Editing by Nivedita Bhattacharjee and Savio D'Souza)
